title: Korigad Fort
subtitle: Scenic Hill Fort Overlooking Aamby Valley near Lonavala
overview: Korigad Fort is a beautiful hill fort located near Lonavala, overlooking the luxurious Aamby Valley. Built around the 15th century, it offers panoramic views of the surrounding valleys and artificial lakes.

The fort was incorporated into the Maratha Empire under Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in 1657. Today, it is one of the most accessible trekking forts, making it a popular weekend destination for trekkers and nature enthusiasts.

highlights.title: Hilltop Fort
highlights.description: Perched at 3,050 feet, the fort provides a commanding view of Aamby Valley and lush green surroundings.

highlights.title: Easy Trek
highlights.description: Ideal for beginners, the trek route is simple yet scenic, especially during the monsoon.

geography.intro: Located around 20 km from Lonavala, Korigad lies at an altitude of 3,050 feet. It’s a table-top fort surrounded by deep valleys and connected to the neighboring Ambavne village.

details.label: Location
details.value: Near Aamby Valley, Lonavala, Pune District

details.label: Built By
details.value: Unknown (Later captured by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj)

details.label: Nearby Attractions
details.value: Aamby Valley, Tung Fort, Pawna Lake

climate.description: Korigad enjoys a pleasant climate most of the year, with monsoon being the most scenic season.

seasons.text: Winter (November–February) – ideal for trekking and photography.

geography.conclusion: Korigad Fort’s accessibility and breathtaking vistas make it an ideal weekend getaway for history lovers and trekkers alike.

activities.title: Trekking
activities.description: A short and scenic trek from Ambavne village, suitable for all age groups.
info: Trek distance: around 2 km from base village.
Takes about 45 minutes to reach the top.

activities.title: Photography
activities.description: Capture stunning landscapes, ancient fort walls, and views of Aamby Valley.
info: Best lighting during early morning or sunset.

activities.title: Temple Visit
activities.description: Visit the ancient temple of Goddess Koraidevi situated at the top of the fort.
info: Temple still used for local worship.
Marathi inscriptions can be found nearby.

attractions.title: Koraidevi Temple
attractions.description: An ancient temple dedicated to Goddess Koraidevi, located at the fort’s summit.

attractions.title: Aamby Valley Viewpoint
attractions.description: A breathtaking viewpoint offering wide views of Aamby Valley and the surrounding hills.

marineLife.intro: Though inland, Korigad’s top hosts small natural and man-made ponds that retain water throughout the year.

items.title: Fort Lakes
items.description: Two water tanks at the top serve as a freshwater source for trekkers.

items.title: Natural Flora
items.description: During monsoon, wildflowers and lush grass cover the entire plateau.

conclusion: Korigad is surrounded by nature in full bloom during monsoon.
Its fort lakes add to the peaceful charm of the place.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Lonavala is the nearest railway station (20 km).
From Lonavala, hire a taxi or drive towards Ambavne village.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: From Mumbai: 110 km via Mumbai–Pune Expressway and Lonavala.
From Pune: 90 km via Paud Road and Aamby Valley route.

bookingTips.description: Carry rain gear during monsoon months.
Wear trekking shoes with good grip.
Don’t miss the panoramic shots of Aamby Valley from the fort walls.
